name: Good Enough To Eat
address: 520 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: Brunch (Eggs Benedict) was tasty and vibe was perfect on a rainy Thursday. Music wasnâ€™t too loud. Carrot cake was yummy- raisins, ginger, perfectly sweetened.
Delicious food
Went for brunch on a Sunday around 1 for 2 people. About a 15-20 min wait. Recommend their walnut banana pancakes :) it comes with strawberry butter
The place is quite unusual but very interesting. Excellent customer service with great simple food were the gem.of this restaurant.

En efecto, es demasiado bueno para dejar pasar desapercibido.
Como todos los restaurantes de su categorÃ­a, las porciones son bastas, enormes, para una barriga descomunal y el tÃ©rmino Pichicatear no existe ahÃ­. La maravillosa atenciÃ³n de la mesera desde que llegas para servirte el cafÃ© caliente, humeante ahora si como se dice: tipo americano, fue el starter para estimular el apetito matutino.
Como ya tenÃ­amos el tiempo medido, no pudimos probar extras y nos fuimos directo al plato fuerte.
Los Waffles descomunales, esponjosos y crocante en su superficie, aunado a la exquisita miel de Maple que sirven ahÃ­ dieron por servido la porciÃ³n de calorÃ­as dulces de ese horario (solamente, hay que aclarar).
Huevo revuelto con tomate y eneldo una combinaciÃ³n no comÃºn, pero exquisita fue el atracÃ³n que me puse yo. Mi colega se atascÃ³ con unos hotcakes, huevos revuelto y crocante tocino.
Me quedÃ© con ganas de probar el Apple crumble y cerezas rojas,que estaba a la entrada en la vitrina que funciona como refrigerador natural por la baja temperatura que habÃ­a en la calle.
Hay que volver. Me pasarÃ­a un par de semanas en cada lugar y me convertirÃ­a en su Cliente cautivo.
New York #eslaonda
La cocina es definitivamente toda #homeMade
1st time visiting this place. My son and I walked in for breakfast and were promptly seated. Service was quick, staff attentive and courteous. Food was good.

Perfect all the way around is all I can say. Food and drinks were great. I had cornbeef and hash with a bacon bourbon drink. It was perfectly paired for the occasion. Definitely will be going back again, but next time to try the desserts!
Pedimos omellets y estaban deliciosos, las porciones son grandes.
Very very disappointing food was bad coffee was bad

Breakfast in the upper west side with no fuss. Hearty portions, friendly folks, good selection. We were hungry and ordered many side dishes along with our breakfastsâ€¦.all was tasty. No wait, quick service, affordable.

Good Enough to Eat has a cozy, classic feel and the staff was friendly and attentive, which I appreciated. The menu has a lot of options, and the portions were generous. That said, the food itself was just okayâ€”nothing bad, but nothing that really stood out either.

Itâ€™s a fine spot if youâ€™re in the neighborhood and want something casual, but I wouldnâ€™t say itâ€™s a destination meal. Overall, an average experience.
Great for brunch, sandwiches are excellent and in general a good selection. Slow service even with only quarter full, so would expect the rush to be a bit too hectic.
Good prices but nothing to write home about.
The service is decent, but the food is mehhhâ€¦ makes me realize good enough is just not enough in NYC .. there are better options out there
Great service, delicious, hearty food
Really liked this cute restaurant for breakfast. I had the French toast and it was delicious. Service was also great and helpful.
Cozy Upper West Side brunch with hearty portions.
big egg benedict and crispy fries.  very nice, must try.

Go here to eat with my uncle. Like the food here and the portions. My uncle likes this place. Today I ordered the BLT and it was good.  My waitress was so nice and sweet. I'm not sure if she was new but I just loved her energy. I asked for a few different things and she didn't seem to get annoyed like some others at other restaurants. She always has a smile . It made us feel relaxed.  We are and we talked a lot . She was very attentive and patient with us.  My lunch was so much I took some of it home. Thank you sweet lady.      We def walked out of there full . Thank you all. ( All the restaurant  crew. )
We couldn't find the restaurant and we learned that for dinner it becomes Greek with a different name. Very disappointing

Highly recommended. This place bustling during brunch, so make sure your whole party is there to get seated quickly! This diner has such great charm. It's got lots of open space and sunlight streaming in, which creates a super inviting atmosphere. Plus, they offer bar seating, tables inside, and even outside seating!

They offer a classic menu that we absolutely loved. We really enjoyed the eggs Benedict and the pancakes for breakfast! Enjoy!

I found this place online because I was looking for someplace to eat near the museum of natural history.  This is a neighborhood place. Friendly staff, cute decor.  The waffles and pancakes were both delicious.  The bacon was thick cut and filling. The strawberry butter and real maple syrup are a nice touch. We will be back. We didn't order dessert, but they looked amazing.

Super breakfast options and their famous strawberry butter with fresh baked biscuits. Had a delicious Athens omelette, some sausage, and my son had a salmon Benedict with poached eggs. Wait staff is super nice but super busy at weekend brunch. We ate outside on the busy avenue but it might have been more relaxed indoors.  Definitely a neighborhood favorite.
Best service, great coffee
El lugar estÃ¡ muy bien ambientado, musica agradable, limpio y buen servicio.
Great atmosphere and beautiful environment. Their house drinks are great but don't try to ask for anything that's not on the menu. Food was very fresh and well flavored! Would definitely come back!
The food was alright.

Came here for breakfast with a friend after running a race in Central Park. I wish I could say we had a great experience but the service from the waiter we had ruined it for us. It was as if he didnâ€™t even want to wait on our table. It took a while to get his attention to even place our orders. And when the food came, not ONCE did he come by and ask how everything was and if we needed anything. Yet he kept waiting on the other two tables beside us and took the table next to usâ€™ order way sooner than he had with us. We had to ask who I believe was the hostess, for condiments and the check. Our waiter didnâ€™t even make eye contact with us, which I thought was very rude (and thatâ€™s coming from someone who used to be a waitress).

As for the food, my friend and I ordered the Astoria Omelette and ProvenÃ§al Omelette which were good - nothing crazy.

I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™d come back here for the sole purpose of the terrible service.
Visiting from London and I loved this place, brilliant customer service. The blueberry French toast was amazing. I was lucky enough to meet the owner who was so welcoming, thank you
Food was good but multiple mistakes on multiple different orders. Wasn't very quick. I got the impression that we showed up at the wrong time. It may well be better at other times.
I love Good Enough to Eat â¤ï¸ I just like their menu, their staff, their food, it's all good!

Sat outdoors and had a really enjoyable experience! The service was great for a busy Sunday brunch, I got the eggs Benedict with delicious poached eggs. The side potatoes were okay but I was pretty full from the rest of the meal.

Aksel is a standout talent behind the barâ€”precise, intuitive, and deeply knowledgeable. His cocktails are impeccably balanced, showcasing both technical skill and a refined palate. Beyond the drinks, his presence elevates the entire experience. he engages with guests thoughtfully, creating a sense of ease and connection thatâ€™s rare to find. In a city of many bartenders, Aksel is one you remember.
Still one of the best brunch spots in NYC

It's important to know that Google has incorrect hours for this restaurant. They're open from 9 a.m.-4 p.m. It becomes a Greek restaurant called Telio Taverna after 4 p.m. My friends and I came here for dinner tonight in the rain thinking we were going to Good Enough to Eat based on the hours Google currently has listed.

This place didnâ€™t live up to the hype. We ordered two lattes and they were horrible.
My omelette was ok but my partnerâ€™s french toast was hard, thank god for the strawberry
Butter they provided. Skip it. Thereâ€™s other places with better food on NYC.
Delicious pancakes!

I really appreciated the service during my visit. Although there was a line, Gus managed it with such efficiency that the wait felt minimal. Axel at the bar was incredibly attentive and friendly, making the experience even better. It's clear that both Gus and Axel truly care about their customers. Thank you for a wonderful experience all around!

Avevo ordinato i blueberry pancakes, ma mi sono arrivati quelli semplici. Buoni, per caritÃ , ma non quello che avevo chiesto. Anche il tÃ¨ caldo Ã¨ arrivato solo dopo averlo richiesto una seconda volta, nonostante il locale fosse praticamente vuoto. Forse ho sbagliato io nellâ€™ordinazione, ma anche le uova strapazzate prese dal mio compagno non ci hanno convinti: condite con cipolla cruda, una scelta discutibile. Prezzi alti.. Non tornerei.
We had a lovely brunch here! The food was delicious and the mimosas were strong. Will definitely be back.
Great food, good prices, and great vibes. I'd definitely eat here again
The strawberry butter is divine
Amazing people and even better food! Gus and all the other staff were so kind and attentive.
Friendly service and delicious pancakes!

Let me tell you about this placeâ€”itâ€™s definitely worth a visit! Iâ€™ll be doing a TikTok about it too, but I had to share my experience here first. Gus, the host, was absolutely amazingâ€”so warm, welcoming, and genuinely kind. We had a fantastic meal, and I even got a brand-new mug to take home. Plus, heâ€™s working on opening up a spot on Mondays! Highly recommend checking it out.

First time in New York and my first stop! Overall, set the mood for the city! The potatoes were a classic! Love the iced lattes and the eggs Benedict! It was our servers third day, and he was so kind and so good at his job! Will be coming back before I leave.
Amazing. Crispy breakfast potatoes were a god send. It was our servers 3rd day and he was absolutely eating. Would come again.

The ambiance, service, and food were absolutely incredible!  Every time we come to the city for a show we try a new place. After eating here we will certainly break that routine in favor of making this our favorite spot!
Good food and decent price but the wait to get into this place can be long. So if youâ€™re hungry and waiting is not an option, find someplace else to go for quick meal.

Cute restaurant, American style food. Got the protein plate, with the biscuits and strawberry butter. Biscuits were unfortunately a bit dry/hard. The strawberry butter was good. The food itself was delicious and fresh. Service was friendly and quick.

ì•„ì¹¨ìœ¼ë¡œ ë¬´ë‚œí•´ìš” ì¹œì ˆí•˜ë³´

Lovely brunch place for families, friends and singles alike. The menu has plenty to choose from, although I would love if vegetarian options were labeled so one could find non-meat options easier.

The eggs Benedict with spinach were yummy and kids loved the pancakes. Try the lavender mimosa if you feel like it, I enjoyed it.

The music was so nice and the service was just right.

Space-wise, it gets busy around 11am, so if you can, arrive around 10 so you donâ€™t have to wait. But if you do have to wait, itâ€™s worth it.

Very solid brunch place. Easily walked in at 10.30am on a Sunday. Standard service with yummy food. I got the guac toast with poached eggs and side salad, tasty and filling! My friend got the french toast. Nothing special but doesnâ€™t need to beâ€” would come again!

Came across 'Good Enough To Eat' whilst walking back from the Natural History Museum on Columbus Ave, New York. It was busy and had a good atmosphere and we were seated quickly. There were quite a few uni students which gave it a good vibe, but equally there was a good age range. We chose a Turkey club sandwich and a feta salad with grilled chicken, coffee, tea and strawberry milkshake and carrot cake which was the best I have ever tasted. Everything was lovely and fresh. It was obviously a popular place as there was a constant stream of customers and delivery drivers collecting orders.
Definitely worth a visit if your in the area.

We were famished after walking around Central Park all day like a couple of wide-eyed tourists.  We stumbled upon this place whilst looking for somewhere for afternoon tea nearby.  The food was great.  What could be better than some apple pie and hot chocolate to replenish our energy ğŸ˜€.

The ambiance at this restaurant is truly inviting, with the music creating an ideal setting for positive energy to kick-start the day. The turkey sausages are a delight to the palate. All in all, a pleasing experience.

Oh but please beware of the coconut cake, itâ€™s super sweet.

Some of the menu like burgers, sandwiches and salad starts from 11 am.

We found this spot on Google after leaving the history museum, wanting to get a good hardy lunch.  This place did not disappoint!  Service and food were excellent! I had the pancake breakfast, my daughter had the chili, and my son in law had the cheeseburger.  Everything was so tasty, filling, and satisfying. The chili really rocked! I also loved the look and vibe of the place, and we vowed to return the next time we're nearby again.
Wow, what a fantastic experience went to meet up and catch up with friends. The service was impeccable, super attentive, and great food options. Tasty. Yummy delitful. Thanks for the service.
Great food options with reasonable prices! Busy (Christmas week) but service was good.  Grain bowl was good.  Came with two biscuits and strawberry butter...yum

You will definitely have to drive around, and look for parking. Not a bad spot for brunch. The staff is friendly, but not that attentive. I tried the Bacon Waffle. I could barely taste the bacon. If you ever do decide to order this dish,â€¦

This place is in a great location and was on our list to visit.  We arrived and were seated straight away, but unfortunately that meant nothing in terms of service and wait time for the food. We were able to place our order quickly but waited over half an hour for the food, which consisted of omelets. For it to have taken so long, I would think the onions would have been cooked down into the omelet, but they were thick and scattered throughout like an afterthought. My side salad was just a bowl of leaves. Dishes were bland. Will not be returning.

Popular diner with good food and service. We ordered the poached eggs and corned beef. I was happy to see that the corned beef was made in house and not from a can. Nothing tasted spectacular and nothing tasted bad.

Amazing breakfast, with generous portions and reasonable prices. My wife and I, along with 2 friends, had brunch here and we really enjoyed our food. My wife and I split seasonal fruit pancakes (blueberry) and an omelette and both were fantastic. I highly recommend stopping by for breakfast or brunch!

La prima colazione/brunch a NYC!!!
Locale internamente ben arredato Ã¨ molto casalingo ma io e la mia ragazza abbiamo optato per lâ€™esterno.
Si trova sulla Columbus av. ma il traffico non da fastidio.
Colazione in stile americano quindi sia dolce che salato.
QualitÃ  e quantitÃ  nella media cioÃ¨ si puÃ² pagare lo stesso e mangiare di piÃ¹ in altri locali.
Comunque lo consiglio.

The atmosphere was great up until the point they sat a lady and her dog next to me. I'm not a fan of eating next animals.  Once the dogs tail touched my arm I packed my food and left.

The home fires are amazing!

The maÃ®tre d' seated me quickly. They allow you to make your own burger. The angus beef patty was delicious. They had a goat cheese add-on option I donâ€™t see very often, as well. They had good service and lively ambience.

A regular brunch place I frequent during Saturday that entails staying uptown or no plans whatsoever. My dining partner and I usually order the same dishes and it has been consistently delicious. Our go to is the stacked pancakes (sweet) and corned beef hash with eggs (savory). The stacked pancakes are made with a mix of flour and cornmeal. The strawberry butter spread and topped with Vermont syrup makes the pancake stacks undeniably delicious! It has actually inspired us to look for a cornmeal pancake recipe and we have replicated this dish, but as strawberry pancakes. The strawberry butter is still something we need to attempt to make. The corned beef hash is definitely homemade, filled with chunks of thick meat. My dining partner would also order the lumberjack because of the thick cut bacon. The bacon has an even amount of meat and fat, with the sweetness and savory taste to it. I have only dined here during brunch time, weekdays and weekends. The place does get packed during popular times, which we try to avoid dining in those times. Since outdoor dining has become a thing, their square footage has increased, accommodating more diners. The cup of brewed coffee is delicious and with free refills. There is a trend in NYC restaurants that do not offer compliments of refills and you can amplify your jitters with a cup or three in this restaurant ! The service is attentive and can get European when they are busy, but the atmosphere is inviting to chat with your dining partner as you wait for your meal.

I wanted to like this place!  With its down-home friendly atmosphere, made from scratch brunch menu items, and real maple syrup, I was sold before the first bite.

Unfortunately, there is room for improvement.  The bacon is really thick cut, so ordering it "crisp" produces something with the consistency of shoe leather.  Also, while the waffles looked scrumptious, they were a little too thick and dense.  There's more to making a really good waffle than just pouring pancake batter into a waffle iron.

The food was definitely "good enough to eat", but with a little work, it could be even better.

This place was always busy when I walked past so I wanted to give it a shot. When we got there, there was only outdoor seating which wasn't too bad. We went for brunch and I got the pancakes with bacon and eggs. The bacon was super thick, but so good. The pancakes were some of the fluffiest pancakes I've had. It also came with strawberry butter, which I've never had, but it was SO good and really added to the pancakes. We'll definitely be back!

Uno dei migliori posti dove fare brunch a manhattan. La scelta Ã¨ vastissima dal dolce al salato alle bevande, il servizio Ã¨ rapido e i ragazzi sono tutti gentili.
Inoltre, appena a 2 minuti a piedi puoi proseguire con una bella camminata a Central
Park dopo aver fatto brunch.

Waren zuvor im Museum und hatten dann Hunger. GlÃ¼cklicherweise fanden wir dieses kleines Lokal. Man fÃ¼hlt sich richtig wohl darin, die Mitarbeiter sind superfreundlich und das Essen war super. Empfehle das Roastbeef Sandwich... sehr sehr lecker.

Sat outside on a windy and blustery day.  Had the Ruben and the home fries.  I will rave about the fries.  The Ruben was top nich but the fries put the meal over the edge.  A pint of the blue point on top made an excellent lunch

Cute breakfast/brunch spot with yummy food. Solid servings and pleasant staff.  You won't leave hungry. The strawberry butter was a sassy surprise. Though the bacon is worth the price of admission.  Check them out.

Staff was friendly yet not very attentive. I gave this place a try because of itâ€™s high Google reviews however Iâ€™m sad to say I was let down. The freshest tasting thing on my plate were the eggs. The fries tasted like they were refired while the sausage tasted old. All in all safe yourself the trip and pick a different place.

Quint place. Cool area. Most of the food was good. Shank steak was ok. Bland. Salsa was bitter and did not add to the taste. Daughter liked the mac'n'cheese. Son liked the burger. Rest was ok. Where this really fell down was the service. New guy or not...he HAS to do more than poor water for his guests. My order wasn't put in so I ate while the rest watched. Salad came just before main course. Server never checked in on us...not once and when ready to pay...no where to be found. Another server had to come help. We were there around 6 on Saturday but the place was not busy. There are lots of options for food on this stretch of the area. I'd try somewhere else based on this experience...owner/manager came by and had a chance to try to make things right.... didn't discount or give us anything as compensation...even after he was told about the experience.....guess he didn't care either....won't be back
